intro: Lippia torresii, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Lippia torresii is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and fragrant foliage.
